title: Next three weeks will be tough, use fuel and LP gas sparingly: PM
body_lines: The next three weeks will be tough for Sri Lanka, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said today (June 07), urging the general public to use fuel and liquefied petroleum (LP) gas sparingly.
Delivering a special statement in the parliament this morning, the Premier stressed the need to limit travel for the time being and to refrain from hoarding the products.
The government is in the process of rectifying the ongoing shortages of fuel and LP gas, he said further.
